definition: lit. to be together from the first beat (idiom)/to hit it off/to click together/to chime in easily
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: We really hit it off that day.
sentences.chinese: 我們當天真的一拍即合。

sentences.english: Both sides hit it off and agreed.
sentences.chinese: 雙方一拍即合，欣然同意了。

sentences.english: Mr Wang's views did not strike an instant chord with his subordinates.
sentences.chinese: 王先生的想法並沒有與他的屬下一拍即合。

sentences.english: Do You Click or Clash With Future Coworkers?
sentences.chinese: 和未來同事是一拍即合還是會產生牴觸？

sentences.english: We hit it off, immediately decided to take a ride to camphor.
sentences.chinese: 我們一拍即合，立刻決定一同搭車去樟木。

sentences.english: And if one does, he'll have to fit in with you.
sentences.chinese: 而一旦他出現，你們就一拍即合。

definition: to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
familiarity at first sight
like-minded (idiom)/fellow enthusiast/kindred spirit
congenial
agreeing with one another/congenial
to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to act jointly/to form a partnership
to regret not having met earlier (idiom); It is nice to meet you finally./It feels like we have known each other all along.
each takes what he needs (idiom)
to agree/to decide after consultation/to come to a compromise
to burgeon/to produce/to conceive/to be in the initial stage
to get to know each other/acquaintance
to join up with sb/to become partner/to take meals regularly in cafeteria
gradually/little by little/in the course of time
thereupon/as a result/consequently/thus/hence
